sense.name: a place of shelter or protection
sense.commentary: REFUGE[+location][+place][+shelter] Note: refers to a physical locale
sense.examples: We made ourselves a nice refuge for the night out of fallen tree branches and brush. These waters are now a marine refuge for all species of sea turtle. This is a refuge for homeless women. It was a beautiful wildlife refuge along a winding river.

sense.name: a state or condition of protection
sense.commentary: REFUGE[+state][+protected] Note: focus is on the condition or state of being protected, sheltered
sense.examples: We sought refuge from the thunderstorm under a large pine tree. During the riots the tourists found refuge in the French Embassy. He could find no refuge from the daily hounding of the press.

sense.name: a resource that aids or helps one
sense.commentary: REFUGE[+manner][+means][+help] [+relation][+resource][+aid] Note: focus is on a means of obtaining protection, relief
sense.examples: Her last refuge was to ask her uncle for a business loan. They are seeking refuge through the court system. Bob found refuge in drinking after his divorce.
